plot: Two children escape their bickering parents through a portal in the bottom of their swimming pool to a magical land watched over by a kind old woman the children call Aunt T.

When their parents tell them that they're divorcing, Sport and Jeb Sharewood must now decide with whom they will live. They decide that they would rather live with Aunt T, the woman they met by traveling through a portal at the bottom of their swimming pool; at the other end is an idyllic world where children play and there are few adults. Aunt T is a nice old woman, but Sport is far more reluctant than Jeb to accept her invitation to stay with them.—garykmcd

The siblings Sport and Jeb Sharewood live with their parents Gloria and Gil that are divorcing and always discussing. They like to be in the swimming pool and one day, they are visited by the boy Whitt, who brings them to visit his Aunt T in a magical land with happy children through a portal in the bottom of the pool. Aunt T invites them to stay, but Sport lies and tells that their parents have resolved their issues and will live together.—Claudio Carvalho, Rio de Janeiro, Brazil
